content: The Office of the Registrar, Military-Connected Benefits & Certifications (MCBC) partners with the VA to assist veterans and eligible dependents with GI BillÂ® Education Benefits. Contact MCBC to initiate benefits.
Post 9/11 GI Bill (Chapter 33) users do not need a tuition deferment. Students using Chapter 35, 1606, or 30 may qualify for a deferred payment of tuition and fees until the last day of classes.

Process: submit a veteran certification request via UAccess; if eligible, MCBC emails a promissory note; take the promissory note to the Bursar's Office; pay all other charges before applying the deferment. To avoid late charges, the deferment must be applied by the Tuition Payment Deadline.

Past-due Veteran deferments accrue interest at 18% per annum. After submitting the certification request, MCBC places a Pending Military Benefit (BVA) indicator to prevent Late Payment Charges for the semester. If also receiving financial aid, it will pay toward the balance; any overage is refunded when VA pays.
